"I'm a Yasuo main complaining about toxicity against me, but these champions are actually bad"

The reason Yasuo in particular gets a bad rap, is because even a shit Yasuo can be useful by pushing R when people get knocked up, and to an extent he doesn't take all that much skill, he takes repetition to actually get good at, mostly just knowing the specifics (How far does the dash travel, what's the length of the Q etc.) will get you going pretty decently.

That and the fact that his passive means he can farm, get to a 2 item power spike and then win the game, assuming you haven't fed all game before then.

yasuo is snowballer. Apparently all snowballers are "fuck easy noob champs" well maybe you shouldn't stuff up and let them snowball then idiots. If he falls behind, he is useless in every factor except for a tiny bit of cc his r gives. If your team doesn't have a knockup and a yasuo hasn't snowballed and fallen behind, he is useless for pretty much the rest of the game. + Yasuo does tiny ass damage unless he is ahead, his crits start around 100 damage (on minions) then only up to around 350 with ie and shiv (minus shiv damage, to minions) and full end builds only end at around 450-650 damage (on minions) its just the fact people don't take the time to learn to beat him.
